If art in music and colour and form be the human effort (like the babe's un- conscious imitation of its father) after God's mind as he spoke sound and light and multiform nature into being, surely the art of the drama is nearest his heart, since with his own breath he endowed humanity with its manifold movement and passion. It must be so; for using this very power of the drama of life over our hearts, he, feeling shame with our shame, veiling his face lest we could not see his glory and live, stooped and wrote his salvation upon the earth with the finger of his flesh.
